divs: sighting detailsi was waiting for a friend outside his house near a wooded area and cow pasture. i was sitting on the grass when i looked up and saw a saucer-shaped craft approaching very slowly from the northeast. it was quite low already and came to a spot directly above me. this occurred i believe in 1966 when i was 6 or 7. i had not experience or reference for flying saucers at that time. i was not afraid at all. just curious about the interesting 'plane' i saw in the sky above me. the craft had a polished aluminum\platinum metal exterior and a very slight dome on top. it seemed the size of an average 3-bedroom house. there were no windows that i could see but on the bottom was a round circle of colored lights, which were changing according to its movement. as it hovered over me the lights rotated a variety of colors very slowly (not sure if the craft itself was rotating). however, after a couple of minutes it ascended slightly more quickly and the lights seemed to rotate more rapidly and with more colors. (and no, this was not like the jupiter ii from lost in space but a lot more polished and streamlined than that.) i believe there were additional, larger circles\lights on the outside of the colored lights. there were no legs or wheels that i could see. no light or anything emanated from the craft. i did have the sensation it was simply checking me out. i do not know if i experience what you would call missing time. i did see my friend afterward as they had some new puppies i wanted to see. i did not tell them about the plane (why should i as i had no idea this was something that should not be in the sky?) there was no noise that i recall, nor vapor trail. it flew off, moving higher in altitude in the same direction from which it came. i think that i did tell my mother when i went home about the round airplane with no wings. i'm sure she was amused. not much of a ufo buff or obsessive but i do believe in what i saw and trust my childhood memory of it.
Summary: daylight sighting hovering craft directly overhead and low to ground
